dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S2925 IS: Reports Reduction Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Warner (for himself and Ms. Ayotte) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for the elimination or modification of Federal reporting requirements.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reports Reduction Act of 2014.

subsection.header: Fire Program Analysis Reports
subsection.text: Notwithstanding the Department of the Interior and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2003 (Public Law 108–7; 117 Stat. 216) and the Department of the Interior, Environment, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2008 (Public Law 110–161; 121 Stat. 2097), the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior shall not be required to submit to Congress reports relating to the Fire Program Analysis system.

subsection.header: Animal Disease Traceability Reports
subsection.text: Notwithstanding the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2013 (Public Law 113–6; 127 Stat. 199), the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Administrator of the Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, shall not be required to submit to Congress reports relating to animal disease traceability.

section.header: Annual report on commercial price trend analysis of the Department of Defense
section.text: Section 892 of the Ike Skelton National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2011 (Public Law 111–383; 10 U.S.C. 2306a note) is amended by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Report of National Advisory Committee on Institutional Quality and Integrity
subsection.text: Section 114 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1011c) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (e); and
by inserting the following:

subsection.header: Notice
subsection.text: The Secretary shall annually publish in the Federal Register—

paragraph.text: a list containing, for each member of the Committee—

subparagraph.text: the member's name;
the date of the expiration of the member's term of office; and
the name of the individual described in subsection (b)(1) who appointed the member; and

paragraph.text: a solicitation of nominations for each expiring term of office on the Committee of a member appointed by the Secretary.

subsection.header: Evaluation reports for Teach To Reach grants
subsection.text: Section 251(f) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1034(f)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking paragraphs (1) and (2); and
by inserting the following:
An eligible partnership receiving a grant under this section shall conduct an evaluation at the end of the grant period to determine—

subparagraph.text: the effectiveness of the general education teachers who completed a program under subsection (c)(1) with respect to instruction of students with disabilities in general education classrooms; and

the systemic impact of the activities carried out by such grant on how each institution of higher education that is a member of the partnership prepares teachers for instruction in elementary schools and secondary schools.

paragraph.text: Each eligible partnership performing an evaluation under paragraph (1) shall report the findings of such evaluation to the Secretary.

subsection.header: Evaluations on an adjunct teacher corps
subsection.text: Section 255 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1035) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (j); and
by redesignating subsection (k) as subsection (j).

subsection.header: Federal TRIO Program report
subsection.text: Section 402H of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070a–18) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the section heading and inserting the following:

section.header: Evaluations and grants for project improvement and dissemination

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (a); and
by redesignating subsections (b) through (d) as subsections (a) through (c), respectively.

subsection.header: Report on supporting postsecondary faculty, staff, and administrators in educating students with disabilities
subsection.text: Section 762 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1140b) is amended by striking subsection (d).

subsection.header: Report on use and impact of funds for improving literacy through school libraries
subsection.text: Section 1251 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6383) is amended by striking subsection (j) and inserting the following:

subsection.header: National Activities Evaluations
subsection.text: From the funds appropriated under section 1002(b)(4) for each fiscal year, the Secretary shall reserve not more than 1 percent for annual, independent, national evaluations of the activities assisted under this section and their impact on improving the reading skills of students. The evaluations shall be conducted not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001, and biennially thereafter.

subsection.header: Interim and final evaluations under Transition to Teaching program
subsection.text: Section 2314 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6684) is repealed.

subsection.header: Report on drug use and violence in elementary and secondary schools
subsection.text: Section 4122 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7132) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Report on activities under Excellence in Economic Education program
subsection.text: Section 5536 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7267e) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Report on State and local activities under healthy, high-Performance schools program
subsection.text: Section 5584 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7277c) is repealed.

subsection.header: Report on use of funds under local flexibility demonstration agreements

paragraph.text: Section 6151(c) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7321(c)) is amended by striking paragraph (10).
Title VI of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended by striking section 6156 (20 U.S.C. 7321e) and inserting the following:

section.text: A State in which a local educational agency that has a local flexibility demonstration agreement is located may not require such local educational agency to provide any application information with respect to the programs included within the scope of that agreement.

subsection.header: Report on State accountability for adequate yearly progress
subsection.text: Section 6164 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7325c) is repealed.

subsection.header: Report on activities for underserved populations
subsection.text: Section 21(b) of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. 718(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking paragraph (4); and
by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (4).

subsection.header: Interagency Committee on Disability Research report
subsection.text: Section 203 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973 (29 U.S.C. 763) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (c); and
by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively.

subsection.header: Report on national activities To improve education of children with disabilities
subsection.text: Section 681(a) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (20 U.S.C. 1481(a)) is amended by striking paragraph (4).

subsection.header: Reports on fraud in the offering of financial assistance for postsecondary education
subsection.text: Section 5 of the College Scholarship Fraud Prevention Act of 2000 (20 U.S.C. 1092d) is repealed.

subsection.header: Report on State fiscal stabilization fund
subsection.text: Section 14010 of division A of the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009 (Public Law 111–5; 123 Stat. 285) is repealed.

section.header: Report on blood lead screening tests
section.text: Section 2503 of the Children's Health Act of 2000 (42 U.S.C. 247b–3a) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking the title and inserting the following:

section.header: Training by the Health Resources and Services Administration

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (b); and
by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b).

subsection.header: Report on adjustment of status of foreign diplomats
subsection.text: Section 13 of the Act of September 11, 1957 (8 U.S.C. 1255b) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking Attorney General each place such term appears and inserting Secretary of Homeland Security; and
by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:

subsection.header: Report to Congress; reduction of quota

paragraph.text: Not later than 30 days after the end of each fiscal year, the Secretary of Homeland Security shall submit to Congress a complete and detailed statement of the facts and pertinent provisions of law relating to each alien whose status was adjusted under this section to that of an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence during the preceding fiscal year.

For each alien whose status was adjusted under this section, the Secretary of State shall reduce by 1, during the current or next following fiscal year, the total number of immigrant visas that are made available to natives of the country of birth of such alien under section 202(e) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1152(e)).

subsection.header: Report on the transfer of immigration functions
subsection.text: Section 478 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 298) is repealed.

subsection.header: Joint annual interagency review of global nuclear detection architecture
subsection.text: Section 1907 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (6 U.S.C. 596a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: in the subsection heading, by striking Annual and inserting Biennial;
in paragraph (1)—

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking once each year— and inserting once every other year—; and

subclause.text: in clause (i), by striking the previous year and inserting the previous two years; and
in clause (iii), by striking the previous year. and inserting the previous two years.; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking once each year, and inserting once every other year,; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)—

subparagraph.text: in the subsection heading, by striking Annual and inserting Biennial;
in paragraph (1), by striking of each year, and inserting of every other year,; and
in paragraph (2), by striking annual and inserting biennial.

subsection.header: Port of Entry Infrastructure Assessment Study
subsection.text: Section 603(a)(3) of the Border Infrastructure and Technology Modernization Act of 2007 (6 U.S.C. 1402(a)(3)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: submit a report that summarizes the most critical infrastructure needs at land ports of entry to—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Appropriations of the Senate;
the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate;
the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate;
the Committee on Appropriations of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives.

subsection.header: National Land Border Security Priorities Plan
subsection.text: Section 604 of the Border Infrastructure and Technology Modernization Act of 2007 (6 U.S.C. 1403) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: by inserting Priorities after Border Security; and
by striking the Committees and all that follows and inserting the congressional committees referred to in section 603;

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(1), by inserting that the Commissioner determines to be at the greatest risk after southern border; and
in subsection (d), by striking a description and inserting a summary.

subsection.header: Annual assessment of adequacy of marine safety workforce
subsection.text: Section 57 of title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (e).

subsection.header: Annual report on marine industry training program
subsection.text: Section 59 of title 14, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking (a) In general.—; and
by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Biennial report on major acquisitions programs

paragraph.text: Title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking section 569a.
The analysis for chapter 15 of title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 569a.

subsection.header: Annual report on minor construction and improvement
subsection.text: Section 656(d) of title 14, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Minor construction and improvement
subsection.text: Each fiscal year the Secretary may expend from amounts made available for the operating expenses of the Coast Guard not more than $1,500,000 for minor construction and improvement projects at any location.

subsection.header: Annual capital investment plan

paragraph.text: Title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking section 663.
The analysis for chapter 17 of title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 663.

subsection.header: Annual report on conveyance of property

paragraph.text: Title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking section 688.
The analysis for chapter 18 of title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 688.

subsection.header: Annual list of projects to Congress

paragraph.text: Title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking section 693.
The analysis for chapter 19 of title 14, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 693.

subsection.header: Annual marine safety strategy, goals, and performance assessments

paragraph.text: Title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking section 2116.
The analysis for chapter 21 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 2116.

subsection.header: Annual report on resource deficiency for especially hazardous cargo
subsection.text: Section 70103(e)(2) of title 46, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term especially hazardous cargo means anhydrous ammonia, ammonium nitrate, chlorine, liquefied natural gas, liquefied petroleum gas, and any other substance, material, or group or class of material, in a particular amount and form that the Secretary determines by regulation poses a significant risk of creating a transportation security incident while being transported in maritime commerce.

subsection.header: Semi-Annual report of expenditures under the Presidential Protection Assistance Act of 1976
subsection.text: The Presidential Protection Assistance Act of 1976 (18 U.S.C. 3056 note) is amended by striking section 9.

subsection.header: Repeal of annual Coast Guard report on drug interdiction
subsection.text: Section 103 of the Coast Guard Authorization Act of 1996 (14 U.S.C. 89 note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Annual report on modernization of National Distress and Response System

paragraph.text: Section 346 of the Maritime Transportation Security Act of 2002 (Public Law 107–295; 14 U.S.C. 88 note) is repealed.
The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Maritime Transportation Security Act of 2002 is amended by striking the item relating to section 346.

subsection.header: Annual report on Coast Guard capabilities and readiness To fulfill national defense responsibilities

paragraph.text: Section 426 of the Maritime Transportation Security Act of 2002 (Public Law 107–295; 14 U.S.C. 2 note) is repealed.
The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Maritime Transportation Security Act of 2002 is amended by striking the item relating to section 426.

subsection.header: Annual summary of fisheries enforcement plans
subsection.text: Section 224 of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2004 (16 U.S.C. 1861b) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Annual report on compliance with security standards established pursuant to maritime transportation security plans
subsection.text: Section 809 of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2004 (Public Law 108–293; 118 Stat. 1088) is amended by striking subsection (i).

subsection.header: Annual report on distant water tuna fleet
subsection.text: Section 421 of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2006 (Public Law 109–241; 120 Stat. 548) is amended by striking subsection (e).

subsection.header: Biennial updates of foreign fishing incursions report
subsection.text: Section 804 of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2006 (Public Law 109–241; 120 Stat. 563) is amended by striking subsection (c).

subsection.header: Combination of annual summary of fisheries enforcement plans and biennial updates on foreign fishing incursion report
subsection.text: Section 4 of the Cruise Vessel Security and Safety Act of 2010 (Public Law 111–207; 16 U.S.C. 1828 note) is amended by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Elimination of annual report on uses of the Oil Pollution Fund
subsection.text: Section 1012 of the Oil Pollution Act of 1990 (33 U.S.C. 2712) is amended by striking subsection (l).

subsection.header: Elimination of biennial report on oil pollution research and development program
subsection.text: Section 7002 of the Oil Pollution Act of 1990 (33 U.S.C. 2761) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (e); and
by redesignating subsection (f) as subsection (e).

subsection.header: Elimination of annual update on liability limit report
subsection.text: Section 603(c) of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2006 (33 U.S.C. 2704 note; Public Law 109–241) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: Recommendations on tug escorts for laden oil tankers
subsection.text: Section 711(a) of the Coast Guard Authorization Act of 2010 (Public Law 111–281; 124 Stat. 2986) is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.header: Risk assessment of transporting Canadian oil sands

paragraph.text: The Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2012 (Public Law 112–213; 126 Stat. 1585) is amended by striking section 722.
The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Act of 2012 is amended by striking the item relating to section 722.

section.header: Elimination of annual report on federally assisted units under lease and per-unit cost

subsection.header: Public law 108–7
subsection.text: Section 217 of title II of division K of the Consolidated Appropriations Resolution, 2003 (42 U.S.C. 1437 note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Public law 108–199
subsection.text: Section 213 of title II of division G of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005 (42 U.S.C. 1437 note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Public law 108–447
subsection.text: Section 214 of title II of division I of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005 (42 U.S.C. 1437 note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Public law 109–115
subsection.text: Section 314 of title III of division A of the Transportation, Treasury, Housing and Urban Development, the Judiciary, the District of Columbia, and Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 2006 (42 U.S.C. 1437 note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Public law 110–161
subsection.text: Section 211 of title II of division K of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2008 (42 U.S.C. 1437 note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Elimination of report on labor obligations under Dominican Republic-Central America-United States Free Trade Agreement

paragraph.text: Section 403 of the Dominican Republic-Central America-United States Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act (19 U.S.C. 4111) is amended to read as follows:

section.header: Periodic meetings of Secretary of Labor with labor ministers of CAFTA-DR countries
section.text: The Secretary of Labor should take the necessary steps to meet periodically with the labor ministers of the CAFTA-DR countries to discuss—

paragraph.text: the operation of the labor provisions of the Agreement;
progress on the commitments made by the CAFTA-DR countries to implement the recommendations contained in the White Paper;
such other matters as the Secretary of Labor and the labor ministers consider appropriate.

The table of contents for the Dominican Republic-Central America-United States Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act (19 U.S.C. 4001 et seq.) is amended by striking the item relating to section 403 and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 403. Periodic meetings of Secretary of Labor with labor ministers of CAFTA-DR countries.

subsection.header: Elimination of requirement for printed copy of Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States
subsection.text: Section 1207 of the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988 (19 U.S.C. 3007) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking in the form of printed copy and all that follows and inserting in the form of electronic media.; and
in subsection (b), by striking , in whatever format,.

subsection.header: Semi-Annual report on policy towards Burma
subsection.text: Section 570 of the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 1997 (Public Law 104–208; 110 Stat. 3009–166) is amended by striking subsection (d).

subsection.header: Annual report on United Nations policy on Israel and the Palestinians
subsection.text: Section 721 of the Admiral James W. Nance and Meg Donovan Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Years 2000 and 2001 (as enacted into law by section 1000(a)(7) of Public Law 106–113 and contained in appendix G of that Act; 113 Stat. 1501A–462) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (c); and
in subsection (d), by striking At the time of the submission of each annual report under subsection (c), and inserting Not less frequently than once each year.

subsection.header: Annual report on United States-Vietnam human rights dialogue meetings
subsection.text: Section 702 of the Foreign Relations Authorization Act, Fiscal Year 2003 (Public Law 107–228; 22 U.S.C. 2151n note) is repealed.

subsection.header: Supplemental appropriations reports
subsection.text: Section 2104 of the Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act for Defense, the Global War on Terror, and Tsunami Relief, 2005 (Public Law 109–13) is repealed.

subsection.header: Accounts subject to audit by the Comptroller General
subsection.text: Section 3524 of title 31, United States Code is amended by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Semi-Annual report on waivers of the prohibition on government contractors conducing business operations in Sudan
subsection.text: Section 6(c)(2) of the Sudan Accountability and Divestment Act of 2007 (50 U.S.C. 1701 note) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The Administrator for Federal Procurement Policy shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report on each request for a waiver under paragraph (1) received by the President.

subsection.header: Annual estimate of harbor maintenance needs

paragraph.text: Section 1537 of the Moving Ahead for Progress in the 21st Century Act (33 U.S.C. 2238a) is repealed.
The table of contents in section 1(c) of the Moving Ahead for Progress in the 21st Century Act is amended by striking the item relating to section 1537.

subsection.header: Quarterly reporting of unobligated funds
subsection.text: Section 618 of division E of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2014 (Public Law 113–76; 128 Stat. 228) is repealed.

section.text: Section 5707(b) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)(A), by striking , and shall report the results of such investigations to Congress at least once a year;
in paragraph (2)—

subparagraph.text: by striking subparagraph (C);
by redesignating subparagraph (D) as subparagraph (C); and
in subparagraph (C), as so redesignated, by striking subparagraph (C) of this paragraph and inserting paragraph (3); and

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
Not later than 5 working days after the date on which the Administrator makes a cost determination required under paragraph (2)(B), the Administrator shall—

subparagraph.text: submit to Congress a report that includes—

clause.text: the results of the investigations conducted under paragraph (1) during the previous year; and
the specific figures determined by the Administrator under paragraph (2)(B); and

subparagraph.text: publish the specific figures determined by the Administrator under paragraph (2)(B) in the Federal Register.

subsection.header: Repeal of annual National Aeronautics and Space Administration reports on whistleblower concerns
subsection.text: Section 30502 of title 51, United States Code, is amended by striking subsection (d).

subsection.header: Modification of frequency of submittal of National Aeronautics and Space Administration reports on coordination with National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration
subsection.text: Section 60505(b) of title 51, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking each year and inserting every other year; and
by striking during the fiscal year and inserting during the 2 fiscal years.

subsection.header: Repeal of requirement for updates on National Aeronautics and Space Administration strategy on minimizing job losses during the transition from the Space Shuttle
subsection.text: Title III of the Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2008 (division B of Public Law 110–161; 121 Stat. 1917) is amended in the sixth paragraph under the heading administrative provisions (51 U.S.C. 70501 note) by striking the last sentence.

subsection.header: Repeal of report on National Aeronautics and Space Administration survey of astronaut health care

paragraph.text: Section 31302 of title 51, United States Code, is repealed.
The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 313 of such title is amended by striking the item relating to section 31302.

subsection.header: Major research equipment and facilities construction
subsection.text: Paragraphs (2) and (3) of section 14(a) of the National Science Foundation Authorization Act of 2002 (42 U.S.C. 1862n–4(a)) are repealed.

subsection.header: Evaluations under the National Science Foundation
subsection.text: Section 19(a)(3) of the National Science Foundation Authorization Act of 2002 (42 U.S.C. 1862n–8(a)(3)) is repealed.
